m_q.target_metric: Sentiment classification for each tweet in Corona_NLP_test.csv
filters: Only text data from OriginalTweet column needs sentiment prediction
sub_questions: What are the sentiment categories in training data?
How is sentiment distributed in training data?
What text features correlate with different sentiments?
What preprocessing is needed for tweet text?

schema_conflicts: Corona_NLP_train.csv has Sentiment column (6 columns) while Corona_NLP_test.csv lacks it (5 columns)
Both files have same column structure except for Sentiment column

scale_issues: UserName and ScreenName appear to be sequential IDs rather than actual usernames
Location data has inconsistent formatting with some entries containing coordinates
cross_source_conflicts: Training data has 41,157 rows while test data has 3,798 rows - significant size difference
Training data includes sentiment labels (Positive, Negative, Neutral, Extremely Positive, Extremely Negative) while test data lacks labels

format_notes: OriginalTweet column contains URLs, hashtags, mentions, and special characters
Some tweets contain line breaks and carriage returns within cells
Location column has mixed formats (city names, coordinates, empty values)
TweetAt uses European date format DD-MM-YYYY

constraints: Predictions must be written to sentiment.csv with column name 'Sentiment'
Sentiment predictions must align with training data categories: Positive, Negative, Neutral, Extremely Positive, Extremely Negative
Each test tweet must receive exactly one sentiment prediction
derived_filters: Remove or handle URLs from OriginalTweet
statistical_tests: Check class distribution in training data
Test for text length correlation with sentiment
